description: Erection of parks maintenance depot comprising a single storey prefabricated storage building adjacent to the rear boundaries of 145-147 Downham Road, a two storey 'green-roofed' workshop/office building immediately north of the Rosemary Gardens paddling pool area, storage containers behind 165-171 Downham Road and a service/parking yard and a new three storey plus attic building containing three x 2 bedroom flats on existing access way between 161 and 165 Downham Road.
decision_conditions: REASON: The proposal would result in an undesirable intensification of use of existing access roads through Rosemary Gardens. This would be likely to give rise to conditions prejudicial to the safety of people using the park together with an increased perception of danger, especially for children, and a perceived loss of amenity and useable space. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies Env 17, R11, R12, T55, T45 and T48 of the Islington Unitary Development Plan (2002).
